title: POQUE rounded
content:
Can anyone ID this font, I have never seen anything like it before

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080921083248im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ppp_4545.jpg)

 [‹ Psychedelic font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080921083248/http:/typophile.com/node/49403 "Go to previous forum topic") [Please help me identify this grunge font. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080921083248/http:/typophile.com/node/49401 "Go to next forum topic")
author: vector

comments.content:
Hi,

This one is SIMILAR.

Alexandria:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/simeonoutwest/alexandria/regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080921083248/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/simeonoutwest/alexandria/regular/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/simeonoutwest/alexandria/regular/")

—  
Jean Ly  
Quantum Signs & Graphics

I have seen something fairly similar. Maybe somebody has done a typeface based upon the lettering of Alphonse Mucha.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080921083248im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_4363_4211.jpg)

Nick Cooke

Nick’s right, it is an Art Nouveau style, but none of the “Nouveau” results at MyFonts matched it very well. P22’s [Mucha](http://web.archive.org/web/20080921083248/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-mucha/) was similar, and TypeArt’s [Miracolo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080921083248/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeart/miracolo/) was another.

- Mike Yanega
